solution_line_template: This is equivalent to one worker working for {num_workers_initial} * {num_days_initial} = <<{num_workers_initial}*{num_days_initial}={equivalent_days_initial}>>{equivalent_days_initial} days.
The pay per worker per day would be ${total_wages_initial} / {equivalent_days_initial} = $<<{total_wages_initial}/{equivalent_days_initial}={pay_per_worker_per_day}>>{pay_per_worker_per_day}.

{num_workers_new} workers working for {num_days_new} days is equivalent to one worker working for {num_workers_new} * {num_days_new} = <<{num_workers_new}*{num_days_new}={equivalent_days_new}>>{equivalent_days_new} days.
It would cost ${pay_per_worker_per_day} * {equivalent_days_new} = $<<{pay_per_worker_per_day}*{equivalent_days_new}={total_wages_new}>>{total_wages_new} to pay the workers for their time.
